alert.note: Alert for Caroline; Kent; Queen Anne's; Talbot (Maryland) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 06 at 7:39PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Talbot, Queen Anne`s, Caroline and southwestern Kent Counties through 815 PM EDT... At 739 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Langford to near Grasonville to near Tilghman Island to near Breezy Point. Movement was east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Easton, Centerville, Talbot, Chestertown, Denton, Centreville, Romancoke, Federalsburg, Greensboro, Oakland, Ridgely, Trappe, St. Michaels, Church Hill, Preston, Oxford, Sudlersville, Goldsboro, Queen Anne and Smithville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM EDT for eastern and northeastern Maryland.
